channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: If Wales' restrictions ease, be sensible - top doctor
item.description: Wales' restrictions on social distancing, indoor gathering and face masks could ease this weekend.

item.title: Holiday park murder accused in court amid tributes to Amanda Selby
item.description: Tributes are paid to Amanda Selby as her brother Matthew appears in court, charged with her murder.

item.title: Skewen: 'Carnage' as flood-hit residents flooded again
item.description: The flash floods hit just after work began on a water management scheme to protect the area.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB sailors Hannah Mills and Eilidh McIntyre win 470 gold
item.description: Hannah Mills becomes the most successful female sailor in Olympic history as she and Eilidh McIntyre win 470 gold at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tragedy became Sliding Doors moment for politician
item.description: Julie James's life changed overnight when the father of her first child was killed in a car crash.

item.title: Covid-19: Hikers' plea for help after positive test
item.description: Paul McErlean and his friends were offered a spare caravan by a former UK home secretary.

item.title: Climate change: Wales 'to build 20,000 low-carbon social homes'
item.description: A Welsh minister is to set out plans to tackle a housing shortage and the problem of climate change.

item.title: Bridgend river death: Friends of boy, 5, 'heartbroken'
item.description: Classmates and neighbours leave tributes near the river where the five-year-old boy was found dead.

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: What else links Wales and Australia?
item.description: They may be 9,000 miles apart, but the TV show's two host countries have surprising things in common.

item.title: Whitchurch: PC denies assaulting suspect during arrest
item.description: PC Rowan Knight allegedly assaulted an individual while performing an arrest in a Cardiff suburb.

item.title: Thunderstorm and heavy rain warning for parts of Wales
item.description: Up to 100mm (4in) of rain could fall in the hardest hit areas on Friday, the Met Office warns.

item.title: Man admits daubing Nazi graffiti on Rhyl War Memorial
item.description: Gareth Bradley, 31, escapes jail after admitting 15 offences including damaging Rhyl War Memorial.

item.title: Climate change minister skied to school in Canada
item.description: Julie James talks about her childhood growing up in Canada, the United States and Wales.

item.title: 'Witnessing my mum be abused by her ex-partner'
item.description: Betty Harper, 19, wrote a song the night her mum, Natasha, was beaten by her then-partner.

item.title: Skewen: 'Carnage' as village floods for second time in a year
item.description: Some people are left picking up the pieces after their homes flooded for the second time this year.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity 2021: Ant & Dec to return to Gwrych Castle
item.description: Ant and Dec are returning to Wales to host I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! from Gwrych Castle.

item.title: French Alps coach crash survivor on mission to help others
item.description: Catrin Pugh overcame 96% burns to graduate with a first class honours degree in physiotherapy.

item.title: Alice in Wonderland sequel Â£5 coin 'evokes childhood memories'
item.description: The coin artist says all generations will enjoy the Through the Looking Glass themed scene.

item.title: Hannah Mills' golden voyage: From Cardiff reservoir to Olympic history maker
item.description: Wales' Hannah Mills becomes the most successful female sailor in Olympic history with a second gold medal in Tokyo to add to Rio success and London 2012 silver.

item.title: Sean Morrison: Cardiff City sights set on automatic promotion, says skipper
item.description: Captain Sean Morrison says automatic promotion is the target for Cardiff City ahead of the new Championship season.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Heavy Dutch semi-final defeat 'tough to take' - GB's Sarah Jones
item.description: GB's Sarah Jones says their 5-1 semi-final loss to the Netherlands in the Tokyo 2020 hockey semi-finals was painful.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sky Brown becomes GB's youngest medallist, plus sailing and boxing success
item.description: Sky Brown wins bronze and becomes Great Britain's youngest summer Olympian with success also coming in sailing and boxing.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB lose to the Netherlands in women's hockey semi-finals
item.description: Great Britain will not retain their Olympic women's hockey title following defeat by the Netherlands in the semi-finals at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: 'Symud at gyfrifoldeb personol' os fydd llacio pellach
item.description: Prif swyddog meddygol yn galw ar bobl i ymddwyn yn "synhwyrol" os fydd rheolau Covid yn llacio ar 7 Awst.

item.title: Teyrnged i ferch 15 oed fu farw mewn parc gwyliau
item.description: Mae brawd Amanda Selby, Matthew, wedi ymddangos yn y llys ar gyhuddiad o lofruddio ei chwaer.

item.title: '20,000 o dai cymdeithasol i'w rhentu erbyn 2026'
item.description: Disgwyl manylion cynlluniau i fynd i'r afael Ã¢ phrinder tai ac allyriadau tÅ· gwydr yng Nghymru.

item.title: Bardd y Mis: Pum munud gyda Derec Llwyd Morgan
item.description: Ambell gwestiwn i ddod i adnabod Bardd y Mis Radio Cymru.

item.title: Aur i Hannah Mills yn yr hwylio yn Tokyo
item.description: Y Gymraes bellach ydy'r hwylwraig fwyaf llwyddiannus erioed o Brydain yn y Gemau Olympaidd.
